Core:PCProperties.Core:Property: ([ "cbf":"sp_charslot", "cbo":\, "cost":400.0, "desc":"Allows you to create and play one additional character at any given time. (so if you could normally have three characters you would now be able to have four.)", "feature":"default", "global":0, "state":1 ])

([ "cbf":"sp_alteration", "cbo":\, "cost":50.0, "desc":"Trait alterations are specifically when changing one body-part to appear different. Do note that this does not include ADDING a trait to an existing body-part (compare \\"blue eyes\\" to \\"seablue eyes\\" versus \\"leg\\" to \\"shapely leg\\"). Trait alterations are approved or declined on a per-request basis. They should generally be non-intrusive and adhere to the concept of show-not-tell; \\"beautiful hair\\" is bad, \\"autumn hair\\" is better.", "feature":"alteration2", "global":0, "state":1 ])

([ "cbf":"sp_gait", "cbo":\, "cost":30.0, "desc":"Buy a gait for the current character. You can then set your preferred gait using the @gait command, and that verb will automatically be used when moving between rooms.", "feature":"gait", "global":0, "state":1 ])

([ "cbf":"sp_nickname", "cbo":\, "cost":10.0, "desc":"Buy a nickname for the current character. The character can then be referred to in-game using the nickname. Please see @help nicknames for further information on this. If you choose an inappropriate nickname, staff will most likely remove it.", "feature":"nickname2", "global":0, "state":1 ])
([ "cbf":"sp_scent", "cbo":\, "cost":30.0, "desc":"Buy a scent for the current character. You can then set your preferred scent using the @scent command.", "feature":"scent", "global":0, "state":1 ])

([ "cbf":"sp_speech", "cbo":\, "cost":30.0, "desc":"Buy a speech pattern for the current character. You can then set your preferred gait using the @speech command, and that verb will automatically be used when talking. ", "feature":"speech", "global":0, "state":1 ])

([ "cbf":"sp_title", "cbo":\, "cost":100.0, "desc":"Buy a title for the current character. You will then be able to toggle that title on and off with the @title command.\\r\\nThis requires The character can then be referred to in-game using the nickname. Please see @help nicknames for further information on this. If you choose an inappropriate nickname, staff will most likely remove it. ", "feature":"title", "global":0, "state":1 ])
